title: Sequential projects should only show first available task
description:
## Problem
In sequential projects, all tasks currently show as available. In real OmniFocus, sequential projects only make the first uncompleted task available.

## Expected Behavior
- Sequential projects: only first uncompleted task is 'available'
- Parallel projects: all uncompleted tasks are 'available'
- Single actions: task is always available
- 'Available' filter should respect this logic

## Acceptance Criteria
- Sequential project shows only first task as available
- Completing a task in sequential project makes next one available
- Parallel projects show all tasks as available
- Available filter correctly filters based on project type
close_reason: Sequential project filtering was already implemented in the perspectives service. Verified that: 1) Only first task shows for sequential projects 2) Completing a task makes the next one available 3) Parallel projects show all tasks. Added comprehensive tests.

title: Projects view needs folder/tree sidebar for navigation
description:
## Problem
Projects perspective shows a flat list of projects. Need a hierarchical tree/folder structure on the left side, similar to real OmniFocus.

## Expected Behavior
- Left side shows folder tree with expandable/collapsible folders
- Folders can contain projects and other folders
- Clicking a folder shows its contents (projects) on the right
- Clicking a project shows its tasks on the right
- Can drill into nested projects

## Acceptance Criteria
- Folder tree sidebar on left in Projects view
- Folders are expandable/collapsible
- Selecting a folder shows its projects
- Selecting a project shows its tasks
- Visual hierarchy with proper indentation
- Breadcrumb or back button for navigation

title: Detail panel should animate (slide in/out from right)
description:
## Problem
When clicking on a task or project to open the detail panel, it appears suddenly without animation.

## Expected Behavior
- Panel should slide in smoothly from the right side
- When closing, panel should slide out to the right
- Animation should be smooth (200-300ms transition)

## Acceptance Criteria
- Detail panel slides in from right when opening
- Detail panel slides out to right when closing
- Animation is smooth and not jarring
- Works on both desktop and mobile

title: Support infinite task nesting (sub-sub-sub-tasks)
description:
## Problem
Currently cannot create nested tasks within tasks (sub-tasks of sub-tasks). In real OmniFocus, tasks and projects are technically the same entity - the only difference is projects don't have a parent. You can nest tasks infinitely.

## Expected Behavior
- Any task can contain child tasks (becoming a sub-project)
- Tasks should be nestable to any depth
- Projects and tasks share the same data model (just projects have no parent)
- UI should show hierarchy with proper indentation

## Acceptance Criteria
- Can create tasks inside any task (not just at project level)
- Unlimited nesting depth supported
- Visual indentation shows hierarchy
- Collapsible task groups
close_reason: Added 'Add Subtask' option to context menu. The data model already supported infinite nesting via parentId. Created tests for flattening logic and subtask menu item.

title: Drag and drop for hierarchy changes (indent/outdent, reparent)
description:
## Problem
Currently drag and drop only reorders items at the same level. Need to support hierarchy changes via drag and drop.

## Expected Behavior
- Drag task slightly right to indent (make it a child of item above)
- Drag task slightly left to outdent (move up a level)
- Drag task onto another task to make it a subtask
- Drag project into folder to move it
- Visual feedback during drag shows where item will land

## Acceptance Criteria
- Can indent tasks by dragging right
- Can outdent tasks by dragging left
- Can drop task onto another to create subtask
- Can drag projects between folders
- Clear visual indicator of drop target
- Works with nested hierarchies

title: Implement 'Available' filter logic
description:
## Problem
OmniFocus has sophisticated logic for determining which tasks are 'available' vs just 'remaining'. Need to implement this.

## Available Logic (from real OmniFocus)
A task is available when ALL of these are true:
1. Task is not completed or dropped
2. Defer date has passed (or no defer date)
3. If in sequential project: task is first remaining task
4. Parent task/project is not blocked or on hold
5. No blocking dependencies

## Expected Behavior
- 'Available' filter shows only truly actionable tasks
- 'Remaining' shows all incomplete (available or not)
- Sequential project logic is respected
- Defer dates are respected
- Project status (active/on hold/blocked) is respected

## Acceptance Criteria
- Available filter implemented correctly
- Respects sequential/parallel project types
- Respects defer dates
- Respects project status
- UI clearly shows available vs remaining tasks
close_reason: Implemented 'Available' perspective with comprehensive filtering: 1) Defer date filtering (future dates hidden) 2) Project status filtering (on-hold projects hidden) 3) Sequential project logic (only first task available). Added tests for all behaviors.
